TiptapTextBlock.description: Primary text component - USE MULTIPLE BLOCKS for data hierarchy!
TiptapTextBlock.data_display_technique: Split stats into 2-3 blocks: huge number (200-300pt) + label (72-96pt) + context (48pt)

critical_rules.texts: Array of text objects. Each item may include 'text', 'fontSize', and a 'style' object.
critical_rules.height: Calculate as fontSize × 1.2 for single line

best_practices: Group related text in one component
NEVER use backgroundColor unless absolutely necessary
Combine multiple styles in texts array
Use for tables with small fonts (8pt+)

positioning_rules.always: Left or right half, never center

CustomComponent.description: POWERFUL component for creating infographics, data visualizations, and interactive elements

when_to_use.statistics: Use animated_progress_rings or kpi_cards for metrics
when_to_use.comparisons: Use comparison_bars or feature_toggle for before/after
when_to_use.timelines: Use interactive_timeline for roadmaps and journeys
when_to_use.processes: Use decision_tree for flows and frameworks
when_to_use.engagement: Use quiz_component or interactive_poll for audience interaction
when_to_use.countdowns: Use countdown_timer for launches and deadlines
when_to_use.visual_interest: Use morphing_blob or floating_icons for modern aesthetics

critical_rules.render: Must be a single ESCAPED STRING with \n for newlines; escape quotes/backslashes; NEVER use backticks or ${} template literals; For literal text children in React.createElement use double quotes ("..."); other string literals may use single quotes
critical_rules.syntax: Use React.createElement, NEVER JSX; no imports/exports/require
critical_rules.signature: function render({ props, state, updateState, id, isThumbnail }) { ... }
critical_rules.root_sizing: Root element style MUST include width: '100%', height: '100%', maxWidth: '100%', maxHeight: '100%', boxSizing: 'border-box', overflow: 'hidden', display: 'flex', flexWrap: 'wrap', position: 'relative'
critical_rules.state_updates: Do not call updateState during render; only in handlers/timeouts
critical_rules.completion: MUST end with complete balanced braces
critical_rules.escaping: Use \n for newlines, \" for quotes inside strings; use string concatenation instead of template literals; For text children prefer double quotes to avoid apostrophe issues

fit_and_responsiveness.container: Include overflowWrap: 'anywhere', wordBreak: 'break-word', textOverflow: 'ellipsis', whiteSpace: 'normal'; alignItems/Content/Justify 'flex-start'
fit_and_responsiveness.size_math: availableWidth = props.width - padding*2; availableHeight = props.height - padding*2
fit_and_responsiveness.text: Clamp font sizes based on availableWidth and text length
fit_and_responsiveness.grids: totalWidth = itemWidth * cols + gap * (cols - 1) <= availableWidth; wrap rows if needed
fit_and_responsiveness.thumbnails: Throttle heavy animations when isThumbnail is true

data_visualization_priority.single_metric: Use hero_metric_showcase or hero_stat_display for maximum impact
data_visualization_priority.multiple_metrics: Use multi_stat_dashboard or kpi_cards with size hierarchy
data_visualization_priority.trends: Combine small line chart with HUGE current value display

avoid: Overly complex logic that could break

Background.description: Slide background - first component (95% should use gradient)
Background.CRITICAL_FORMAT: NEVER use gradientStartColor, gradientEndColor, gradientDirection - use gradient object

gradient.when_to_use: DEFAULT CHOICE - 95% of slides should use gradients for visual appeal and professionalism
gradient.MANDATORY_STRUCTURE: Must have 'gradient' object with 'type', 'angle', and 'stops' array

WRONG_FORMAT.WHY: This is LEGACY format and will be REJECTED

color.when_to_use: RARE - Only 5% of slides when specific minimalist design is required
best_for: Rare cases where gradient would interfere

Background.design_guidance: ALWAYS default to gradients - they add depth, sophistication and visual appeal. Only use solid colors when absolutely necessary.
